name: Alexis Inn & Suites Nashville Airport Opryland

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We came to TN to visit family, however for convenience we scheduled a late flight in and had our family pick us up the next day.
reviews.title: Great Value and Service

reviews.text: We stayed for 1 night at the Alexis. It is a short ride from the airport and very clean. We arrived after midnight, dead tired. Got our room key and went to our room, only to find the room was already occupied.
reviews.title: Great value for the money

likes.disliked: — location ... felt a little isolated, only nearby dining options were fast food establishments

reviews.text: I went back to the desk and woman at reception apologized profusely. Not a problem, things happen. And I got the feeling this does NOT happen often here. She upgraded us to a suite. (I wish I had her name, she was extremely nice and very professional). It was a very nice spacious room. Again, very clean. Coffee in the room, hairdryer, everything we needed and a comfortable bed.
reviews.title: Fantastic Stay Great staff.

likes.liked: — Location Hotel is close to Opryland and airport area and great value

reviews.text: A previous poster is right and there are only 2 restaurants in walking distance but for us, not a problem. the morning Breakfast was very nice. Lots of variety and hot eggs, sausage, waffles. My only complaint was no fruit but it was not a huge deal.
reviews.title: Good price/location - could use updating

reviews.text: We had the morning to kill so Tina at the front desk recommended Grey Line tours. We are happy we took her suggestion. We got picked up and dropped off at the hotel. Very reasonable and we got to see a lot of Nashville in a short period of time. They have several different tours but we saw the recording studios, went to see and take pic at the Parthenon, got to tour Ryman, went to the Country Music Hall of Fame, and spent a bit of time on Honky Tonk row on Broadway.
reviews.title: Great place to stay for the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was absolutely wonderful for the value and it came with a delicious continental breakfast.
reviews.title: Couldn't be better for the price
Great hotel at a great value
reviews.text: If your looking for a value-priced hotel that is clean, friendly, and convienient then look no further. Our family of 4 stayed here over the Thanksgiving Holiday and it was very nice. The hotel staff was very friendly. It was convenient to local attactions, the airport, and dining. The room was clean and well decorated. It was very quiet as well. The breakfast was an average continental breakfast. It did have waffles, sausage, eggs, biscuits as well. Only negatives: coffee was weak, water had strong chlorine smell, and our phone in our room didn't work.

Our daughter attends Vanderbilt University and we go to Nashville often to visit her. Most of the nicer hotels near Vanderbilt's campus cost at least $150 per night. We don't mind the five-mile drive to the Alexis because we save a lot of money; therefore, we can visit our daughter more often. The rooms are fine! The beds are fantastic!! The pillow-top queen beds sure beat the full-size beds you get in many hotels. We have stayed at the Alexis at least eight times and have never had a bad experience. The free breakfast is very good. Personally, I think no one can complain about the Alexis since the prices are so good. It sure beats a lot of places that I've stayed where I've paid more.
reviews.title: Great bargain compared to other hotels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have seen a few bad reviews on this hotel, but do not understand how anyone could issue a bad report. We have
reviews.title: Great Place Worth More

likes.liked: — IT WAS CLEAN AND PRICED VERY REASONABLE.

reviews.title: Nashville's Best Kept Secret
reviews.text: stayed in 4 stars that were not as good. .My wife and I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone. Especially anyone on a budget. We thought it was great. AAAAAA+++++

Alexis Inn and Suites is a nice hotel in a good location, with only one major flaw. I'm sure you're most interested in the major flaw so I'll get that over with right away. The problem with this hotel is that their walls are paper thin, particularly the ones between the hallway and the rooms. Both nights we were there, people ran up and down the halls all night, yelling to each other, talking on cell phones, and slamming doors all hours of the night. This wouldn't have been so terrible if the walls weren't so thin, but you can hear every single sound inside the rooms. We had to turn the tv up loud to be able to drown out the noise, but it was extremely hard to get any sleep. There was also some noise from the busy intersection the hotel is located in front of. There is only one entrance/exit and it is hard to turn left onto the highway. We just turned right and turned around when needed, so that wasn't a big deal. It sounds bad so far, but there were good things about this hotel as well. The best thing was the price. We paid $50.00 + tax per night, which is extremely cheap in Nashville. The location is good as well. We were only 5 minutes away from Opry Mills and the Grand Ole Opry. Most of the musical shows and such were very close by. The hotel room was very nice, but a little small. The staff of the hotel are wonderful though. Everyone from the manager to the custodians were very polite, helpful, and willing to go out of their way for us. The hotel also has a small workout room, which is basically a treadmill and exercise bike, and a computer room as well for you to use the internet. All in all, we enjoyed our stay, but it would have been much better if we could have gotten some sleep. If the noise doesn't bother you, this is a wonderful motel to stay at.
reviews.title: Don't Expect A Good Night's Sleep

likes.disliked: — The noise heard through the walls

aka: Alexis Inn & Suites Nashville Airport Opryland Hotel
